meanings.definition: To surpass in height or stature.
meanings.sent1: The tall mountain was outtowering all the other peaks in the range.
meanings.sent2: The skyscraper outtowered all the buildings in the city skyline.
meanings.sent3: The giraffe felt proud to be outtowering all the other animals at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: His ambition to succeed was outtowering any obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The majestic oak tree outtowered the surrounding forest, casting a long shadow.

meanings.definition: To rise above or exceed in importance or influence.
meanings.sent1: Her kindness and generosity outtowered her wealth and possessions.
meanings.sent2: The leader's vision for the future outtowered any previous achievements.
meanings.sent3: The little act of kindness ended up outtowering all the grand gestures.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his craft outtowered the expectations of his peers.
meanings.sent5: The impact of her words outtowered any other speeches given that day.
